H0.text: It is designed to move with a motor is the statement that best describes a complex machine.

H1.text: It is constructed from machineâ€‘made parts is the best statement that describes a complex machine.

H2.text: The best description of a complex machine is that it is made of more than one simple machine.

H3.text: It is built from more than one type of material is the best description of a complex machine.

A4.text: Simple machines can be regarded as the elementary 'building blocks' of which all more complicated machines (sometimes called 'compound machines') are composed.

A5.text: Starting with four types of joints, the revolute joint, sliding joint, cam joint and gear joint, and related connections such as cables and belts, it is possible to understand a machine as an assembly of solid parts that connect these joints.

A6.text: Rolamite, the only elementary machine discovered in the 20th century.

A7.text: The mechanical advantage of a compound machine is just the product of the mechanical advantages of the simple machines of which it is composed.

A8.text: Similarly, the efficiency of a compound machine is also the product of the efficiencies of the series of simple machines that form it.
